A True

algorithms False

. False

algorithms True
. False

A False

. False

It False
captures False

notion False
of False

being False

least False
as False
difficult False
as False
another False
problem False
. False

, False

than False

of False

, True

of True

The False

is False

reduction True
. False

This False
means False
that False
the False
reduction False
process False
takes False
polynomial True
time True
. False

For False
example False
, False

of False

to False

of False

This False
means False

for False

can False
be False

to False
square False
an False
integer False
. False

Indeed False
, False

to False

of False

algorithm False
. False

we False
see False
that False

is False
not False
more False
difficult False
than False
multiplication False
, False
since False
squaring False
can False
be False
reduced False
to False
multiplication True
. False

motivates False

concept False
of False
a False

for False
a False

class False
. False

A False

for False
a False

of False

if True

. False

no False

is True

than True

, False

an False
algorithm False
for False

allows False

to False

in True
C. True

course False
, False

of True

. False

. False

In False

that False

Starting False

concept True

This True
concept True
contrasted True
and True

of True
pre True

of True

, False

. False

new False
concept False

independent False
work False
of False
Donald True
Davies True
at False
the False

) False

. False

is True

and True
inspiring True
numerous True
packet True
switching True
networks True
in True
Europe True

the False
decade False
following False
, False

of False

concept False
in False

in False

. False

Packet False
switching False
contrasts False
with False
another False
principal False
networking False
paradigm False
, False
circuit True
switching True
, False
a True
method True
which True
pre True
allocates True
dedicated True
network True
bandwidth True
specifically True
for True
each True
communication True
session True
, False
each False
having False
a False
constant False
bit False
rate False
and False
latency False
between False
nodes False
. False

In False
cases False
of False
billable False
services False
, False
such False
as False
cellular False
communication False
services False
, False
circuit True
switching True
is True
characterized True
by True
a True
fee True
per True
unit True
of True
connection True
time True
, True
even True
when True
no True
data True
is True
transferred True
, False
while False
packet False
switching False
may False
be False
characterized False
by True
a True
fee True
per True
unit True
of True
information True
transmitted True
, True
such True
as True
characters True
, True
packets True
, True
or True
messages True
. False

Packet False
mode False
communication False
may False
be False
implemented False
with True
or True
without True
intermediate True
forwarding True
nodes True
( False
packet False
switches False
or False
routers False
) False
. False

Packets False
are False
normally False
forwarded False
by True
intermediate True
network True
nodes True
asynchronously True
using True
first True
in True
, True
first True
out True
buffering True
, True
but True
may True
be True
forwarded True
according True
to True
some True
scheduling True
discipline True
for True
fair True
queuing True
, False
traffic False
shaping False
, False
or False
for False
differentiated False
or False
guaranteed False
quality False
of False
service False
, False
such False
as False
weighted False
fair False
queuing False
or False
leaky False
bucket False
. False

In False
case False
of False
a False
shared False
physical False
medium False
( False
such False
as False
radio False
or False
10BASE5 False
) False
, False
the True
packets True
may True
be True
delivered True
according True
to True
a True
multiple True
access True
scheme True
. False

Baran False
developed False
the True
concept True
of True
distributed True
adaptive True
message True
block True
switching True
during False
his False
research False
at False
the False
RAND False
Corporation False
for False
the False
US False
Air False
Force False
into False
survivable True
communications True
networks True
, False
first False
presented False
to False
the False
Air False
Force False
in False
the False
summer False
of False
1961 False
as False
briefing True
B True
265 True
, False
later False
published False
as False
RAND False
report False
P False
2626 False
in False
1962 False
, False
and False
finally False
in False
report False
RM False
3420 False
in False
1964 False
. False

Report False
P False
2626 False
described False
a True
general True
architecture True
for True
a True
large True
scale True
, True
distributed True
, True
survivable True
communications True
network True
. False

The False
work False
focuses False
on False
three False
key False
ideas True
: False
use True
of True
a True
decentralized True
network True
with True
multiple True
paths True
between True
any True
two True
points True
, True
dividing True
user True
messages True
into True
message True
blocks True
, True
later True
called True
packets True
, False
and False
delivery True
of True
these True
messages True
by True
store True
and True
forward True
switching True
. False

Starting False
in False
1965 False
, False
Donald True
Davies True
at False
the False
National False
Physical False
Laboratory False
, False
UK False
, False
independently True
developed True
the True
same True
message True
routing True
methodology True
as True
developed True
by True
Baran True
. False

He False
called False
it False
packet True
switching True
, False
a False
more False
accessible False
name False
than False
Baran False
's False
, False
and False
proposed True
to True
build True
a True
nationwide True
network True
in True
the True
UK True
. False

He False
gave False
a False
talk False
on False
the False
proposal False
in False
1966 False
, False
after False
which False
a False
person False
from False
the False
Ministry False
of False
Defence False
( False
MoD False
) False
told False
him False
about False
Baran False
's False
work False
. False

A False
member False
of False
Davies False
' False
team False
( False
Roger False
Scantlebury False
) False
met False
Lawrence False
Roberts False
at False
the False
1967 False
ACM False
Symposium False
on False
Operating False
System False
Principles False
and False
suggested True
it True
for True
use True
in True
the True
ARPANET True
. False

In False
connectionless False
mode False
each True
packet True
includes True
complete True
addressing True
information True
. False

The False
packets False
are False
routed False
individually True
, True
sometimes True
resulting True
in True
different True
paths True
and True
out True
of True
order True
delivery True
. False

Each True
packet True
is True
labeled True
with True
a True
destination True
address True
, True
source True
address True
, True
and True
port True
numbers True
. True
It True
may True
also True
be True
labeled True
with True
the True
sequence True
number True
of True
the True
packet True
. False

This False
precludes False
the False
need False
for False
a False
dedicated False
path False
to False
help False
the False
packet False
find False
its False
way False
to False
its False
destination False
, False
but False
means False
that False
much False
more False
information False
is False
needed False
in False
the False
packet False
header False
, False
which False
is False
therefore False
larger False
, False
and False
this False
information False
needs False
to False
be False
looked False
up False
in False
power False
hungry False
content False
addressable False
memory False
. False

Each False
packet False
is False
dispatched False
and False
may False
go False
via False
different False
routes False
; False
potentially False
, False
the False
system False
has False
to False
do False
as False
much False
work False
for False
every False
packet False
as False
the False
connection False
oriented False
system False
has False
to False
do False
in False
connection False
set False
up False
, False
but False
with False
less False
information False
as False
to False
the False
application False
's False
requirements False
. False

At False
the False
destination False
, False
the True
original True
message/data True
is True
reassembled True
in True
the True
correct True
order True
, True
based True
on True
the True
packet True
sequence True
number True
. False

Thus False
a False
virtual False
connection False
, False
also False
known False
as False
a False
virtual False
circuit False
or False
byte False
stream False
is False
provided False
to False
the False
end False
user False
by False
a False
transport False
layer False
protocol False
, False
although False
intermediate False
network False
nodes False
only False
provides False
a False
connectionless False
network False
layer False
service False
. False

Connection False
oriented False
transmission False
requires False
a True
setup True
phase True
in True
each True
involved True
node True
before True
any True
packet True
is True
transferred True
to True
establish True
the True
parameters True
of True
communication True
. False

The False
packets False
include False
a True
connection True
identifier True
rather True
than True
address True
information True
and True
are True
negotiated True
between True
endpoints True
so True
that True
they True
are True
delivered True
in True
order True
and True
with True
error True
checking True
. False

Address False
information False
is False
only False
transferred False
to False
each False
node False
during False
the False
connection False
set False
up False
phase False
, False
when False
the False
route False
to False
the False
destination False
is False
discovered False
and False
an False
entry False
is False
added False
to False
the False
switching False
table False
in False
each False
network False
node False
through False
which False
the False
connection False
passes False
. False

The False
signaling False
protocols False
used False
allow False
the False
application False
to False
specify False
its False
requirements False
and False
discover False
link False
parameters False
. False

Acceptable False
values False
for False
service False
parameters False
may False
be False
negotiated False
. False

Routing True
a True
packet True
requires True
the True
node True
to True
look True
up True
the True
connection True
id True
in True
a True
table True
. False

The True
packet True
header True
can True
be True
small True
, True
as True
it True
only True
needs True
to True
contain True
this True
code True
and True
any True
information True
, True
such True
as True
length True
, True
timestamp True
, True
or True
sequence True
number True
, False
which False
is False
different False
for False
different False
packets False
. False

Both False
X.25 False
and False
Frame False
Relay False
provide True
connection True
oriented True
operations True
. True
But True
X.25 True
does True
it True
at True
the True
network True
layer True
of True
the True
OSI True
Model True
. True
Frame True
Relay True
does True
it True
at True
level True
two True
, True
the True
data True
link True
layer True
. False

Another False
major False
difference False
between False
X.25 False
and False
Frame False
Relay False
is False
that False
X.25 False
requires False
a True
handshake True
between True
the True
communicating True
parties True
before True
any True

are True
transmitted True
. False

Frame False

does False
not False
define False
any False
such False
handshakes False
. False

X.25 False
does False
not False
define False
any False
operations False
inside False
the False
packet False
network False
. False

It False
only False
operates False
at False
the False
user False
network False
interface False
( False
UNI False
) False
. False

Thus False
, False
the False
network False
provider False
is False
free False
to False
use False
any False

it False

inside False
the False

. False

X.25 False
does False

re False
transmission False
procedures False
at False

UNI False
, False
and False
its False
link False
layer False

) False

procedures False
. False

Frame False
Relay False
is False
a False

of False

's False
layer False
two False

, False

and False

such False

operations False

only False

on False
a False

to False

. False

Any False
retransmissions False

be False

out False
by False
higher False
layer False
protocols False
. False

The False
X.25 False

is False
part False
of False

protocol False

, False
which False

, False

The False
immune False
system False
is False
a True
system True
of True
many True

structures True
and True
processes True
within True
an True
organism True
that True
protects True
against True
disease True
. False

To False
function False

must False
detect False
a True
wide True

of True
agents True
, True

, True
from True

to True
parasitic True

from False

healthy False

. False

a False

( False

. False

the True

. False

Thus False
, False

as False
a False

of True

price True
of True

. False

And False

, False

this False

. False

amongst True

nature True
of True

. False

) False

. False

is False

between True

for True

up False
the False

. False

Examples False

, False

abilities False
, False

. False

Competition False
amongst False

tends False
to False
drive False
up False

to False
the False
nature False
of False
the False
job False
, False

is False
a False

of False
workers False
for False

. False

and True

may False

. False

may False
also False

, True

influence True
, True
or True

. False

On False
the False
other False
hand False
, False
higher True
economic True
inequality True
tends False
to False
increase False
entrepreneurship True
rates True
at False
the False
individual False
level False
( False

employment False
) False
. False

However False
, False
most False
of False
it False
is False
often False
based False
on False
necessity True
rather True
than True

The False
Intergovernmental False
Panel False
on False
Climate False
Change False
( False
IPCC False
) False

a False
scientific False

under False
the False

of False
the True
United True
Nations True
, False
set False
up False

the False
request False
of False
member False

. False

It False
was False
first False

1988 False

two False

organizations False

( True

) True

( True

) True

and False
later False

. False

`` False

would False
